slides.title: Welcome to Accounting in Tally
slides.content:
# Accounting in Tally

Take your Tally skills to the next level with **advanced accounting concepts** and practical applications.

## What You Will Learn

- **Receivables and Payables** - Bill-by-bill management
- **Bank Reconciliation** - Matching bank records
- **Cost Centers** - Department-wise accounting
- **Multi-Currency** - Foreign transactions

## Advanced Accounting Features

| Feature | Benefit |
|---------|--------|
| Bill-by-Bill | Track individual invoices |
| Cost Centers | Departmental analysis |
| Budgets | Planning and control |
| Interest Calc | Automatic interest |
| Bank Recon | Match statements |

## Enabling Advanced Features

**Path:** F11 > Accounting Features

```
Maintain Bill-by-Bill Details: Yes
Use Cost Centres: Yes
Maintain Budgets and Controls: Yes
Use Reversing Journals: Yes
Use Optional Vouchers: Yes
```

> **Advanced features** transform Tally into a powerful business tool!

slides.title: Bill-by-Bill Accounting
slides.content:
# Bill-by-Bill Management

## What is Bill-by-Bill?

Tracking **individual invoices** and their payments rather than just balances.

## Enabling Bill-by-Bill

### In Ledger Master

```
Ledger: ABC Customer
Under: Sundry Debtors
Maintain Bill-by-Bill: Yes
Default Credit Period: 30 days
```

## Sales Invoice Entry

```
+----------------------------------+
| Sales Voucher (F8)               |
+----------------------------------+
| Party: ABC Customer              |
| Invoice No: INV-001              |
| Amount: Rs. 50,000               |
+----------------------------------+
| Bill Allocation:                 |
| Type of Ref: New Ref             |
| Name: INV-001                    |
| Due Date: 15-Feb-2024            |
| Amount: Rs. 50,000               |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Receipt Against Bill

```
+----------------------------------+
| Receipt Voucher (F6)             |
+----------------------------------+
| Account: Cash                    |
| Party: ABC Customer              |
| Amount: Rs. 30,000               |
+----------------------------------+
| Bill Allocation:                 |
| Type of Ref: Against Ref         |
| Name: INV-001                    |
| Amount: Rs. 30,000               |
+----------------------------------+
| Pending on INV-001: Rs. 20,000   |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Reference Types

| Type | When to Use |
|------|------------|
| New Ref | New invoice/bill |
| Against Ref | Payment against specific bill |
| Advance | Payment before invoice |
| On Account | General payment |

> **Bill-by-Bill** provides complete receivables visibility!

slides.title: Bank Reconciliation
slides.content:
# Bank Reconciliation in Tally

## Why Reconcile?

- Match bank statement with books
- Identify discrepancies
- Ensure accuracy
- Catch errors and fraud

## Enabling Bank Reconciliation

### In Bank Ledger

```
Ledger: HDFC Bank
Under: Bank Accounts
Effective Date for Reconciliation: 01-Apr-2023
```

### Enable in Voucher Entry

```
F12 > Voucher Configuration
Show Bank Allocations: Yes
```

## Entering Bank Date in Vouchers

### Payment Voucher

```
+----------------------------------+
| Payment Voucher                  |
+----------------------------------+
| Date: 15-Jan-2024                |
| Bank: HDFC Bank                  |
| Cheque No: 100234                |
| Bank Date: [Leave blank initially]|
+----------------------------------+
```

## Bank Reconciliation Process

**Path:** Gateway > Banking > Bank Reconciliation

### Steps

1. Select Bank Account
2. Enter Statement Date
3. Match transactions with bank statement
4. Enter Bank Date for matching items
5. Save reconciliation

## Reconciliation Screen

```
+------------------------------------------+
| Bank Reconciliation: HDFC Bank           |
| Statement Date: 31-Jan-2024              |
+------------------------------------------+
| Date   | Particulars | Amount  | Bank Dt |
+------------------------------------------+
| 05-Jan | Rent Payment| 10,000  | 07-Jan  |
| 10-Jan | Supplier Pmt| 25,000  | [Enter] |
| 15-Jan | Cheque 234  | 15,000  |         |
+------------------------------------------+
```

> **Monthly reconciliation** is essential for accuracy!

slides.title: Bank Reconciliation Statement
slides.content:
# BRS - Bank Reconciliation Statement

## Understanding BRS

```
Balance as per Bank Statement:    Rs. 150,000

Add: Cheques Deposited but not cleared
     - Cheque 456: Rs. 25,000
     - Cheque 789: Rs. 15,000
                                    Rs. 40,000

Less: Cheques Issued but not presented
     - Cheque 234: Rs. 30,000
     - Cheque 567: Rs. 20,000
                                   (Rs. 50,000)

Balance as per Books:             Rs. 140,000
```

## Common Reconciliation Items

| Item | Effect |
|------|--------|
| Cheque issued, not presented | Add to bank balance |
| Cheque deposited, not cleared | Subtract from bank balance |
| Bank charges not recorded | Record in books |
| Interest credited | Record in books |
| Direct debits | Record in books |

## Viewing BRS in Tally

**Path:** Gateway > Display > Account Books > Cash/Bank Books

Select Bank > Press **F5** for Reconciled View

## Reports

### Summary View

```
+----------------------------------+
| Bank Account: HDFC Bank          |
| Statement Date: 31-Jan-2024      |
+----------------------------------+
| Balance as per Books:   140,000  |
| Cheques in Clearing:     40,000  |
| Uncleared Cheques:      (50,000) |
+----------------------------------+
| Balance as per Bank:    150,000  |
+----------------------------------+
```

> **Regular BRS** catches errors early!

slides.title: Cost Centers
slides.content:
# Cost Center Accounting

## What are Cost Centers?

Cost centers allow tracking of **expenses by department, project, or location**.

## Enabling Cost Centers

**F11 > Accounting Features**

```
Maintain Cost Centres: Yes
Use Cost Centre for Purchases: Yes
```

## Creating Cost Centers

**Path:** Gateway > Create > Cost Centre

### Cost Center Master

```
+----------------------------------+
| Cost Centre Creation             |
+----------------------------------+
| Name: Marketing Department       |
| Under: Primary Cost Category     |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Cost Center Categories

### Structure

```
Primary (Root)
    |
    +-- Administration
    |       +-- HR
    |       +-- Finance
    |       +-- IT
    |
    +-- Operations
    |       +-- Production
    |       +-- Quality
    |
    +-- Sales
            +-- North Region
            +-- South Region
```

## Allocating Costs

### In Expense Voucher

```
+----------------------------------+
| Payment Voucher                  |
+----------------------------------+
| Expense: Salary                  |
| Amount: Rs. 100,000              |
+----------------------------------+
| Cost Centre Allocation:          |
| Marketing: Rs. 40,000            |
| Sales: Rs. 35,000                |
| Finance: Rs. 25,000              |
+----------------------------------+
```

> **Cost centers** enable department-wise analysis!

slides.title: Multi-Currency Accounting
slides.content:
# Multiple Currency Transactions

## Enabling Multi-Currency

**F11 > Accounting Features**

```
Allow Multi-Currency: Yes
```

## Creating Currency

**Path:** Gateway > Create > Currency

### Currency Master

```
+----------------------------------+
| Currency Creation                |
+----------------------------------+
| Symbol: USD                      |
| Formal Name: US Dollar           |
| Suffix Symbol: $                 |
| Decimal Places: 2                |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Exchange Rates

### Standard Rate

**Path:** Gateway > Alter > Currency

```
Rate of Exchange:
Date: 01-Jan-2024
Rate: Rs. 83.25 per USD
```

### Voucher-Specific Rate

Enter during transaction:

```
+----------------------------------+
| Sales Voucher (Foreign)          |
+----------------------------------+
| Party: US Customer               |
| Currency: USD                    |
| Amount: $1,000                   |
| Exchange Rate: Rs. 83.50         |
| INR Value: Rs. 83,500            |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Forex Gain/Loss

### On Receipt

```
Sale recorded: $1,000 @ 83.25 = Rs. 83,250
Received:      $1,000 @ 83.50 = Rs. 83,500
Forex Gain:                     Rs.    250
```

## Multi-Currency Reports

- Forex Gain/Loss Report
- Currency-wise Outstanding
- Exchange Rate History

> **Handle foreign transactions** accurately with multi-currency!

slides.title: Interest Calculation
slides.content:
# Automatic Interest Calculation

## Enabling Interest

**F11 > Accounting Features**

```
Activate Interest Calculation: Yes
```

## Configuring Interest in Ledger

**Ledger Master**

```
+----------------------------------+
| Ledger: ABC Customer             |
| Under: Sundry Debtors            |
+----------------------------------+
| Activate Interest Calculation: Yes|
| Interest Style: Simple Interest  |
| Rate: 18% per annum              |
| Per: Month                       |
| Calc on Opening Balance: Yes     |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Interest Parameters

| Parameter | Options |
|-----------|--------|
| Style | Simple / Compound |
| Rate | Percentage |
| Period | Day / Month / Year |
| Calc Basis | From due date / days |

## Example Calculation

```
Invoice: Rs. 100,000
Due Date: 15-Jan-2024
Payment Date: 15-Mar-2024
Overdue: 60 days
Rate: 18% per annum

Interest = 100,000 x 18% x (60/365)
Interest = Rs. 2,959
```

## Interest Report

**Path:** Display > Statements of Accounts > Outstanding > Interest Receivable

```
+------------------------------------------+
| Interest Receivable as on 31-Mar         |
+------------------------------------------+
| Party      | Principal | Days | Interest |
| ABC Corp   | 100,000   | 60   | 2,959    |
| XYZ Ltd    | 50,000    | 30   | 740      |
+------------------------------------------+
```

> **Automate interest** on overdue accounts!

slides.title: Voucher Classes
slides.content:
# Customizing Voucher Types

## What are Voucher Classes?

Voucher classes let you **customize voucher behavior** for specific transaction types.

## Creating Voucher Class

**Path:** Gateway > Alter > Voucher Type

### Example: PDC Receipt Class

```
+----------------------------------+
| Voucher Type: Receipt            |
+----------------------------------+
| Name of Class: PDC Received      |
| Use Class for PDC: Yes           |
| Credit Account: Bills Receivable |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Common Voucher Classes

### For Receipts

| Class | Purpose |
|-------|--------|
| Cash Receipt | Cash payments |
| Bank Receipt | Cheque/online payments |
| PDC Received | Post-dated cheques |

### For Payments

| Class | Purpose |
|-------|--------|
| Cash Payment | Cash disbursements |
| Bank Payment | Cheque payments |
| PDC Issued | Post-dated cheques |

## Using Voucher Class

### During Entry

```
+----------------------------------+
| Receipt Voucher                  |
+----------------------------------+
| Date: 15-Jan-2024                |
| Voucher Class: PDC Received      |
| [Class specific fields appear]   |
| PDC Date: 15-Feb-2024            |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Benefits

- Standardize entries
- Pre-fill common fields
- Separate tracking
- Better reporting

> **Voucher classes** streamline repetitive entries!

slides.title: Optional and Reversing Vouchers
slides.content:
# Special Voucher Types

## Optional Vouchers

### What Are They?
Vouchers that are **not included in reports** until confirmed.

### Enabling

```
F11 > Accounting Features
Use Optional Vouchers: Yes
```

### Creating Optional Voucher

```
During voucher entry:
Press Ctrl+L to mark as Optional

+----------------------------------+
| Voucher marked as OPTIONAL       |
| Will not affect accounts until   |
| converted to regular voucher     |
+----------------------------------+
```

### Use Cases
- Pending approvals
- Tentative transactions
- What-if scenarios

## Reversing Journals

### What Are They?
Journals that **automatically reverse** on a specified date.

### Enabling

```
F11 > Accounting Features
Use Reversing Journals: Yes
```

### Creating Reversing Journal

```
+----------------------------------+
| Journal Voucher (F7)             |
+----------------------------------+
| Mark as Reversing Journal: Yes   |
| Reversal Date: 01-Apr-2024       |
+----------------------------------+
| Prepaid Insurance (Dr)  12,000   |
| Insurance Expense (Cr)  12,000   |
+----------------------------------+
```

### Result

Entry auto-reverses on 01-Apr-2024:

```
Insurance Expense (Dr)    12,000
Prepaid Insurance (Cr)    12,000
```

> **Special vouchers** handle complex scenarios easily!

slides.title: Financial Statements Analysis
slides.content:
# Analyzing Financial Statements

## Balance Sheet Analysis

**Path:** Gateway > Reports > Balance Sheet

### Ratio Analysis

```
+----------------------------------+
| Key Ratios (Press Alt+F1)        |
+----------------------------------+
| Current Ratio: 2.5:1             |
| Quick Ratio: 1.8:1               |
| Debt-Equity: 0.5:1               |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Profit and Loss Analysis

### Percentage View

Press F12 > Show Percentages: Yes

```
+----------------------------------+
| Profit and Loss (% of Sales)     |
+----------------------------------+
| Sales:              100%         |
| Purchases:           60%         |
| Gross Profit:        40%         |
| Expenses:            25%         |
| Net Profit:          15%         |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Comparative Analysis

### Period Comparison

```
+------------------------------------------+
| Comparative P&L                          |
+------------------------------------------+
| Particulars | 2023-24  | 2022-23 | Var% |
| Sales       | 10M      | 8M      | +25% |
| Expenses    | 8M       | 6.5M    | +23% |
| Net Profit  | 2M       | 1.5M    | +33% |
+------------------------------------------+
```

## Cash Flow Statement

**Path:** Gateway > Reports > Cash Flow

```
+----------------------------------+
| Cash Flow Statement              |
+----------------------------------+
| Operating Activities:   500,000  |
| Investing Activities:  (200,000) |
| Financing Activities:  (100,000) |
+----------------------------------+
| Net Cash Flow:          200,000  |
+----------------------------------+
```

> **Deep analysis** reveals business health!

slides.title: Group Company and Branches
slides.content:
# Multi-Branch Accounting

## Group Company

### Creating Linked Companies

1. Create parent company
2. Create branch companies
3. Link through Group Company feature

### Benefits

- Consolidated reporting
- Inter-branch transactions
- Combined trial balance

## Branch Accounting

### Within Single Company

Use Cost Centers for branches:

```
Primary
  |
  +-- Mumbai Branch
  +-- Delhi Branch
  +-- Chennai Branch
```

### Separate Companies

Create individual companies:

```
ABC Company - Mumbai (1001)
ABC Company - Delhi (1002)
ABC Company - Chennai (1003)
```

## Inter-Branch Transactions

### Stock Transfer

```
Mumbai sends goods to Delhi:

Mumbai Books:
  Delhi Branch A/c (Dr)
  Sales/Stock Transfer (Cr)

Delhi Books:
  Purchases/Stock Transfer (Dr)
  Mumbai Branch A/c (Cr)
```

## Consolidated Reports

**Path:** Gateway > Alt+F3 > Select Companies

Select multiple companies to see:
- Combined Trial Balance
- Consolidated Balance Sheet
- Group Outstanding

> **Multi-branch accounting** supports business growth!

slides.title: Data Security and Users
slides.content:
# Security in Tally

## User Management

### Creating Users

**Path:** Gateway > Alt+F3 > Security Control > Create

```
+----------------------------------+
| User Creation                    |
+----------------------------------+
| Name: Accounts Manager           |
| Password: ********               |
| User Type: Data Entry            |
+----------------------------------+
```

## User Types

| Type | Access Level |
|------|-------------|
| Owner | Full access |
| Administrator | Most functions |
| Data Entry | Entry only |
| Display Only | View reports only |

## Security Levels

### Defining Access

```
+----------------------------------+
| Security Level: Accountant       |
+----------------------------------+
| Allow Voucher Entry: Yes         |
| Allow Alter Masters: No          |
| Allow Delete Vouchers: No        |
| Access Reports: Yes              |
| Period Restriction: Current Year |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Company Password

### Setting Password

**Path:** F11 > Set Company Password

### Password Features

- Require on company open
- Different for each company
- Administrator override

## Tally Vault

Encrypt and protect company data:

```
Alt+F3 > Tally Vault > Password Protect
```

> **Security protects** your financial data!

Categories:

> **Advanced features** handle complex requirements!

slides.title: Summary and Key Takeaways

- Outstanding reports
- Aging analysis

### Bank Reconciliation

- Clearing items

### Cost Centers

- Cost allocation
- Variance analysis

### Advanced Features
- Multi-currency transactions
- Interest calculation
- Voucher classes
- Budgeting

## Quick Reference

| Feature | Enable In |
|---------|----------|
| Bill-by-Bill | Ledger Master |
| Cost Centres | F11 |
| Multi-Currency | F11 |
| Budgets | F11 |
| Bank Recon | Bank Ledger |

## Key Reports

|--------|------|

| Cost Centre | Display > Statements > Cost Centres |
| Bank Recon | Banking > Reconciliation |

Explore:
- Inventory Management in Tally

- Advanced Tally Features

> **You now have advanced accounting skills** in Tally!
